source_sentence: 佛本行集經卷第十五
translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Volume 15

source_sentence: 隋天竺三藏闍那崛多譯
translation: Sui Tianzhu Tripiṭaka Jñānagupta Translation

source_sentence: 淨飯王夢品第十七
translation: The Seventeenth Chapter of King Śuddhodana's Dream

source_sentence: 「爾時，作瓶天子以神通力，欲令太子發出家心，即於其夜，與淨飯王七種夢相。
translation: "At the time, the Vase-Maker Prince, with his supernormal powers, wanted to make the prince want to leave home, so he gave King Jōtan seven dream images that night.

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王眠臥床上，於睡夢裏，見如是相：第一所謂夢見，有一大帝釋幢，其幢周匝，有於無量無邊人，舉從迦毘羅城東門出。
translation: While sleeping on his bed, King Jōtan saw these things in his dream: First, in the so-called dream, he saw a large banner of Indra surrounded by measureless and limitless people emerging from the eastern gate of Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 第二所謂夢見，太子乘十大象，駕馭眾車，從迦毘羅城南門出。
translation: The second thing that's called a dream sees the crown prince riding in ten large elephants and driving numerous chariots out of the southern gate of Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 第三所謂夢見，太子駕駟馬車，端坐其上，從迦毘羅城西門出。
translation: The third thing that's called a dream-vision is that the prince drove a chariot with an arrow and horse sitting atop it, and he emerged from the west gate of Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 第四所謂夢見，雜寶莊嚴一輪，從迦毘羅城北門出。
translation: The fourth thing I saw in a dream was a wheel of mixed jewels emerging from the northern gate of Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 第五所謂夢見，太子在迦毘羅城之中央大街衢內，手執一搥，撾打大鼓。
translation: The fifth thing I saw in a dream was the crown prince holding a hammer in his hand and beating a large drum in the middle of the main street of Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 第六夢見，此迦毘羅城之處中，有一高樓，太子坐上，四面散擲無量諸寶，而其四方，復有無量無邊億數諸眾生來，將此寶去。
translation: The sixth dream saw that there was a high building in the middle of Kapilavastu, and while sitting on it, the prince scattered measureless treasures on all sides, and measureless, unlimited, and billions of sentient beings came from all directions to remove those treasures.

source_sentence: 第七夢見，此迦毘羅城外不遠，有於六人，舉聲大哭，號咷流淚，各以兩手，自拔頭髮，宛轉于地。
translation: In the seventh dream, I saw six people not far from this city of Kapilavastu who raised their voices, wept loudly, and shed tears as they each pulled their hair out of their heads with their two hands and twirled to the ground.

source_sentence: 「時，淨飯王於夢裏見如是之相，心大惶怖，恐畏毛竪，遍體戰慄，驚悸疑怪，忽然而寤。
translation: "When he saw such a figure in his dream, King Jīvaka was terrified, his hair standing on end in fear, his whole body trembling, and frightened and wondering, and he suddenly woke up.

source_sentence: 覺已即喚所當宮內諸大臣來，而勅彼等作如是言：『卿等知不？
translation: When he awoke, he summoned the ministers in his palace and commanded them to come, saying, 'Do you know this?'

source_sentence: 我於今夜，夢見如是大恐怖事，七種次第如前所列，皆悉說之。』
translation: Tonight, I dreamt that I saw such great fears, and I've explained them all in the sevenfold sequence listed above.'

source_sentence: 復勅語言：『汝等善持此等諸夢，莫令忘失。
translation: I also commanded them to say, 'Hold on to these dreams well, and don't let them be forgotten.

source_sentence: 明日坐殿，可於眾內奏我令知。』
translation: Tomorrow, when you sit in the palace, you may present them to me in public so that I'll know about them.'

source_sentence: 而諸臣等聞王勅已，即白王言：『謹如王勅，實不敢違。』
translation: After they heard the king's command, the ministers said to the king, 'I did as the king commanded, and I really wouldn't dare to disobey it.'

source_sentence: 天曉王坐，即於眾中，具以夜夢，諮奏王知。
translation: At sunrise, the king sat down and presented the king with a nighttime dream.

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王聞臣白已，即召國內善解占夢諸婆羅門而告之言：『汝等大智！
translation: Upon hearing the ministers' confessions, King Jōtan summoned the brāhmaṇas in his country who were skilled at divining dreams and told them, 'Great wisdom, you!

source_sentence: 解我所夢，有何果報？
translation: "What is the result of understanding my dreams?

source_sentence: 我夢如是，如前所說。』
translation: I dreamed this, just as I said before.'

source_sentence: 彼等大智諸婆羅門，聞王勅已，各共思惟，量宜可否，而白王言：『大王！
translation: After they heard the king's order, those brahmins of great wisdom considered together whether it would be appropriate, and they said to the king, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知我等未曾聞如是夢，我等聞已，心意迷荒，不知此夢有何果報？』
translation: You should know that we've never heard such a dream before, and after hearing it, our minds are lost, and we don't know what the result of this dream will be.'

source_sentence: 時淨飯王聞諸占夢婆羅門等作如是語，心復憂愁，作如是念：『或我太子，不得作於轉輪聖王，莫復得已而還墜落轉輪王位？
translation: When the king of Jīvaka heard the dream-wielding brāhmaṇas say this, he was distressed and had this thought, 'Perhaps my prince won't become a wheel-turning sage king, or will he fall back to the position of wheel-turning king after attaining it?'

source_sentence: 今我心內，極大憂愁，誰能決我如此疑結？』
translation: Now, I have great sorrow in my heart; who can resolve this fetter of doubt in me?'

source_sentence: 「爾時，作瓶天子在於淨居宮殿之內，遙見淨飯大王如是憂愁不樂，見已忽然從彼天宮，隱身而來，化作一梵婆羅門身，頭有螺髻，以鬘為冠，智慧聰明，端正盛少，著黑鹿皮，以為衣服，立在淨飯王宮門外，唱如是言：『我能善解淨飯王夢，決斷所疑。』
translation: "At the time, the Vase-making Prince was inside the palace of Jōgū and saw from a distance the great King Jōtoku thus distressed and unhappy. When he saw this, he suddenly came from that heavenly palace in a hidden body and transformed into the body of a Brahmā Brahman with a conch-tufted head, a crown made of garlands, wisdom and intelligence, a correct appearance, and black deerskin for clothing.

source_sentence: 時，當門人聞婆羅門作此語已，速疾往詣淨飯王所，長跪諮白淨飯王言：『大王！
translation: After hearing this from the Brāhmaṇa, the person in charge of the gate quickly went to King Jīvaka, knelt down long enough, and told King Jīvaka, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知門外有一婆羅門立，口稱是言：「我善能解一切諸夢。」』
translation: You should know that outside the gate there's a brāhmaṇa standing there, saying, 'I'm a good interpreter of all dreams.'

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王即便勅喚此婆羅門，令入宮中，入已歡喜，即宣勅問彼婆羅門，作如是言：『汝巧智慧大婆羅門！
translation: The king of Jīvaka then summoned this brāhmaṇa and had him enter the palace, and when he did, he rejoiced and announced that he would ask this brāhmaṇa about it, saying, 'You clever, wise, great brāhmaṇa!'

source_sentence: 今知已不？
translation: Do you now know that it is not?

source_sentence: 我於昨夕夜半之時，見如是等七種夢相。
translation: At the midnight hour last night, I saw these seven kinds of dream-like appearances.

source_sentence: 第一見有一帝釋幢，無量無邊，百千人民，左右圍遶，共舉此幢，從迦毘羅城東門出，乃至去此迦毘羅城，道里不遠，見有六人，舉聲大哭，以手拔髮。
translation: First, I saw a banner of Indra, measureless and limitless, surrounded by a hundred thousand people on either side, all holding up this banner as they exited the eastern gate of Kapilavastu and went as far as Kapilavastu, which is not far from here, and saw six people holding up their voices and crying out, pulling their hair out with their hands.

source_sentence: 我今恐怖，心意迴遑，夢相既然，未知善惡。
translation: Now, I'm terrified, my mind wanders, and I don't know what's good or bad since I've seen their dream form.

source_sentence: 汝可為我一一解之。』
translation: You can explain them all for me.'

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王作是說已，默然而住，聽其解釋。
translation: After he spoke thus, the Vairocana King waited silently and listened to his explanation.

source_sentence: 「爾時，作瓶天子即白王言：『大王！
translation: "It was then that the Vase-Maker Prince said to the king, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知王所夢見，一帝釋幢，有於無量無邊人民，左右圍繞，共舉此幢，從城東門而將出者，此是大王悉達太子，與於無量百千諸天，左右圍遶，當捨太子，從宮閤內，踰城出家；此夢是彼於先瑞相。
translation: You should know that the king's dream in which he saw a banner of Indra surrounded by measureless and limitless people who were holding up the banner and about to leave through the city's east gate was that of Prince Siddhârtha, the great king, surrounded by measureless hundreds of thousands of gods who were about to abandon the prince and pass through the palace to leave home; this dream was his first portentous appearance.

source_sentence: 「『又復大王所見，太子乘十香象，駕馭眾車，從城南門而出行者，彼出家已，即便證得於薩婆若及以十力；此夢是彼於先瑞相。
translation: "'Also, the great king saw the prince riding on a ten-scented elephant and riding in a multitude of chariots as he exited the city's south gate and traveled there; after leaving home, he then realized the ten powers of the sarvajña and the ten powers; this dream was his first portentous appearance.'

source_sentence: 「『又復大王所見，太子乘駟馬車，從城西門而出行者，彼出家已，證薩婆若，具足而得四無所畏；此夢是彼於先瑞相。
translation: "'Also, the great king saw a prince riding in an arrow chariot and traveling out of the west gate of the city who, after leaving home, realized paranirmita-vaśavartin and fully attained the four forms of fearlessness; this dream was his first portentous appearance.

source_sentence: 「『又復大王所夢，雜寶莊嚴一輪，從城北門而出行者，彼出家已，證得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提後，於天人前轉於無上微妙法輪；此夢是彼於先瑞相。
translation: "'Also, the great king dreamed of a man who traveled through the northern gate of the city in a wheel adorned with various treasures and who, after leaving home, realized unsurpassed, sublime enlightenment and turned the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma in front of gods and humans; this dream was his first portentous appearance.'

source_sentence: 「『又復大王所夢，太子在迦毘羅城之中央四衢道內，手執一搥，擊大鼓者，彼出家已，證得菩提，轉法輪時，諸天各各揚聲唱言，其音上徹乃至梵天，傳相告知，響遍色界；此夢是彼於先瑞相。
translation: "'Also, the great king dreamed that the prince was holding a hammer in his hand and beating a large drum in the middle of the four roads of Kapilavastu, and when he realized enlightenment after leaving home and turned the Dharma wheel, the gods each raised their voices and called out words that reached up to the Brahma heavens and spread their messages, resounding throughout the form realm; this dream was his first portentous appearance.

source_sentence: 「『又復大王所夢，太子在迦毘羅城之處中樓上而坐，四面散擲種種寶者，彼成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提已，於諸天人八部眾前，當散如是眾妙法寶，謂四念處，及四正勤、四如意足、五根、五力、七覺、八道，種種諸法；此夢是彼於先瑞相。
translation: "'Also, the great king dreamed that the prince was sitting on a high building in the city of Kapila, scattering various treasures on all sides, and that after he had achieved supreme perfect enlightenment, he would scatter in front of a multitude of gods and humans from the eight groups such marvelous Dharma treasures as the four abodes of mindfulness, the four correct endeavors, the four miraculous abilities, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven awarenesses, the eight paths, and various other things; this dream was his first portentous appearance.'

source_sentence: 「『又復大王所夢，去此迦毘羅城，其外不遠，見有六人，舉聲大哭，手拔髮者，太子出家，當得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: "'Furthermore, the great king had a dream, and not far from here in Kapilavastu, he saw six people with raised voices and loud cries, pulling their hair out, and the prince leaving home and about to attain unsurpassed, correct enlightenment.

source_sentence: 得菩提已，而於彼時有諸六師，其心應當生大憂惱，所謂富蘭那迦葉、摩婆迦羅瞿奢子、阿耆那只奢甘婆羅、波羅浮多迦吒耶那、那闍夷禆耶私致只子、尼乾陀若低子等；此夢是彼於先瑞相。』
translation: After attaining bodhi, there were six teachers whose minds would have been greatly distressed, namely, Pūraṇa-kāśyapa, Māvakāraghoṣa-son, Ajñātaśagarbha, Prabhūtaratakāyaṇa, Nārājña-kauśalya-son, and Nirgrantha-jñāniputra; this dream was their first portentous appearance.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，作瓶天子為淨飯王解說夢已，白大王言：『大王！
translation: "After he explained the dream to King Jīvaka, the Vase-making Prince said to the king, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 宜應心生歡喜，勿懷恐怖憂畏不樂。
translation: It's better to be encouraged at heart than to harbor fear and grief.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 此夢吉祥，獲善果報，須自慶幸，慎莫有慮。』
translation: This dream is auspicious; obtain a good result; rejoice in yourself; and don't worry about it.'

source_sentence: 如是安慰淨飯王已，忽然不現。
translation: After thus reassuring King Jīvaka, he suddenly disappeared.

source_sentence: 「時，淨飯王聞婆羅門如是解夢說，云吉祥善果報已，即為太子，更重增加五慾之具，令太子心染著愛戀，望不出家。
translation: "After hearing the Brāhmaṇa explain the dream this way, saying that it was an auspicious and good reward, King Jōtoku then added more of the five implements of desire to the crown prince's mind, causing him to become defiled by attachment and to hope that he wouldn't leave home.

source_sentence: 爾時太子在於宮內，恣意而受五慾之事，不可思議。
translation: At the time, the prince was in the palace and enjoyed the five objects of desire at will, which are inconceivable.

source_sentence: 佛本行集經道見病人品第十八
translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Chapter 18 of the Sick Person's View of the Way

source_sentence: 「爾時，作瓶天子復更思惟：『此之護明菩薩大士，在彼宮內，著於五慾，放逸情蕩，已經多時。
translation: "At that point, the Vase-making Prince of God also thought, 'This great luminous protector bodhisattva has been in that palace for a long time, addicted to the five desires, and dissipated in his passions.

source_sentence: 世間無常，盛年易失，護明菩薩應當早捨宮內出家。
translation: The world is impermanent, and youth is easily lost; the luminous protector bodhisattva should leave the palace early and leave home.

source_sentence: 我今可先為其作相，勸請覺悟，令速厭離。』
translation: Now, I can first create a picture for him to encourage awakening and make him quickly abandon it.'

source_sentence: 如是念已，作瓶天子神通力故，亦是護明菩薩大士宿福因緣，坐於宮內，忽然發心，欲出園林觀看遊戲。
translation: After this thought, the divine power of the clay pot goddess, who was also the cause of the great luminous protector of bodhisattvas' long-standing merits, sat inside the palace and suddenly had the intention to leave the garden to watch the games.

source_sentence: 「爾時，太子召喚馭者而告之言：『謂善馭者！
translation: "At that point, the prince summoned the harnesser and told him, 'That's right, good harnesser!

source_sentence: 汝可速疾莊嚴好車，我欲出城向於園苑，遊戲悅目觀看叢林。』
translation: You may quickly adorn a nice chariot, for I want to leave the city and go to the park to play with my eyes and look at the forest.'

source_sentence: 是時馭者白太子言：『如聖子勅，我不敢違。』
translation: The Harnesser then said to the prince, 'I dare not disobey the noble son's order.'

source_sentence: 馭者既聞太子如是教令語已，即往奏白淨飯王言：『大王！
translation: After hearing the prince's words of instruction, the Harnesser went to King Jīvaka and said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知太子今欲出向園林觀看善地。』
translation: 'You should know that the prince now wants to go out to the grove and look at the good ground.'

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王出勅宣令國內人民，悉使莊嚴掃灑清淨迦毘羅城，並遣除却一切諸草沙礫荊蕀朽木、土堆糞穢臭處，皆令平坦。
translation: The king of Jīvaka then sent a command to the people of the country to adorn and cleanse the city of Kapilavastu and to remove all the grass, sand, thorns, rotten wood, and smelly mounds of dirt and dung, making them all level.

source_sentence: 乃至園內，所有女名樹木之者，還令以女瓔珞之具而莊嚴之，男名樹木，以男瓔珞，而用挍飾。
translation: Even in the garden, they caused all the trees named for women to be adorned with jewelry for women and the trees named for men to be adorned with jewelry for men.

source_sentence: 乃至道上，於太子前，或老或病，不聽出現，莫使太子見已生於厭離之想。
translation: Even on the road, he wouldn't allow them to appear before the prince, whether elderly or ill, so that the prince wouldn't become disillusioned with them after seeing them.

source_sentence: 是時馭者莊挍車已，進太子言：『已嚴車訖，唯願聖子！
translation: After decorating the chariot, the conductor then approached the prince and said, 'Have you finished decorating the chariot, venerable son!'

source_sentence: 善自知時。』
translation: He well knows the time.'

source_sentence: 是時太子，即乘寶車，乘已執持大王威神巍巍盛德，從城南門，漸漸而出，欲向園林觀矚嬉戲。
translation: The prince then rode in his jeweled chariot, and after riding in it, he took hold of the majestic and imposing attributes of the great king and gradually left the city through the south gate, intending to go to the grove to look around and play.

source_sentence: 「爾時，作瓶天子即於太子前路，化作一病患人，連骸困苦，水注腹腫，受大苦惱，身體羸瘦，臂脛纖細，痿黃少色，喘氣微弱，命在須臾。
translation: "At the time, the Vase-making Prince was transformed into a sick man on the road ahead of the prince, suffering from severe hardship, a swollen belly filled with water, and great distress.

source_sentence: 臥糞穢中，宛轉呻喚，不能起舉，欲語開口，纔得出聲，唱云叩頭，乞扶我坐。
translation: He's lying in the filth, wandering and groaning, unable to lift himself up, wanting to speak and open his mouth, but he barely makes a sound, singing, "Bow down, please help me sit down.

source_sentence: 是時太子，見彼病人，乃至口言唱扶我起。
translation: The prince then saw that sick man and even spoke, saying, "Help me get up!

source_sentence: 太子見彼病患人已，問馭者言：『謂善馭者！
translation: After he saw that sick man, the prince asked the banner, 'That's a good banner!'

source_sentence: 此是何人？
translation: Who is this?

source_sentence: 腹肚極大，猶如大釜，喘息之時，身遍戰慄，臂脛纖軟，身體尫羸，痿黃無色，或復唱言：「嗚呼阿孃！」
translation: Their bellies are so large they resemble large cauldrons, and when they breathe, they tremble all over, their arms and legs are weak, their bodies are weak, and they are yellow and colorless, and they sometimes sing, "Aah!"

source_sentence: 或復稱言：「嗚呼阿爺！」
translation: They may also say, "Woo-hoo, Grandpa!"

source_sentence: 悲切酸楚，不忍見聞，依託他身，方能起止。』
translation: They are so sad and distressed that they can't bear to see or hear them, and they rely on another body to be able to raise them.'

source_sentence: 時，作瓶天子以神通力，教馭者報於太子言：『願聖子聽！
translation: With supernatural powers, the Vase-Maker Prince then instructed the harnesser to report to the prince, saying, 'May the noble son listen!'

source_sentence: 此名病人。』
translation: This is called a sick person.'

source_sentence: 太子復問彼馭者言：『稱病人者，此是何名？』
translation: The prince then asked the barker, 'What's the name of this person who calls himself a patient?'

source_sentence: 馭者報言：『大聖太子！
translation: The Harnesser reported, 'Great holy prince!

source_sentence: 此人身體，不善安隱，威德已盡，困篤無力，死時欲至，無處歸依；父母併亡，無處告訴。
translation: This person's body is poorly composed, his authority and virtue have ended, he's frail and powerless, and when he's about to die, he has nowhere to turn to, and his parents have both died, so he has nowhere to tell them.

source_sentence: 已無歸依，無告訴故，此人不久，自應命終。
translation: Because he has no refuge and no place to tell them, this person's life will soon come to an end.

source_sentence: 欲得求活，極大困苦，必當不濟；望覓差日，無有是處，唯待時耳。
translation: If he wants to live, he'll be in great trouble and won't be helped; he hopes to find a better day, but there's nowhere to go but to wait for the right time.

source_sentence: 大聖太子！
translation: Great holy prince!

source_sentence: 以是因緣故名病也。』
translation: It's because of this cause that it's called illness.'

source_sentence: 而有偈說：「『太子問於馭者言，　　此人何故受是苦？
translation: And there's a verse that says, "The prince asked the barker, 'Why is this person suffering?'

source_sentence: 馭者奉報於太子，　　四大不調故病生。』
translation: The Ruler reported to the Crown Prince that the four elements were out of whack, and so illness arose.'

source_sentence: 「太子復問於馭者言：『此人為當獨一家法？
translation: "The prince then asked the Harnesser, 'Does this person have a separate household?'

source_sentence: 為當一切世間眾生悉有是法？』
translation: Why should all sentient beings in the world have this teaching?'

source_sentence: 馭者報言：『此之病法，非獨一家，一切天人眾生雜類，皆悉未免。』
translation: The harnesser reported, 'This is not a single disease, but all gods, humans, sentient beings, and various other beings are not spared.'

source_sentence: 太子復言：『我亦此病，未過未脫，會當似彼成如此事，嗚呼可畏！』
translation: The prince then said, 'I'm also sick, and I've yet to pass away. I will do something like that, which is truly frightening!'

source_sentence: 太子即告其馭者言：『謂汝馭者！
translation: The prince then addressed his barker, saying, 'You barker!

source_sentence: 若我此身，不脫是病，具茲病法，難得度者，我今不假至彼園林遊戲受樂，可迴車駕還入宮中，我當思惟。』
translation: 'If this body of mine doesn't part with this illness, and it's difficult to get rid of it because of the way it's sick, I won't pretend to go to that forest to play and enjoy myself, but I'll turn back in my chariot and drive back into the palace, and I'll think about it.'

source_sentence: 馭者答言：『如太子勅。』
translation: The Harnesser replied, 'As the prince has commanded.'

source_sentence: 是時馭者，既受教已，迴車向宮。
translation: After he had been instructed, the conductor turned his chariot around and headed back to the palace.

source_sentence: 是時太子，還入宮內，端坐思惟：『我亦當病，病法未現，豈得縱情？』
translation: The prince then went back into the palace, sat down, and reflected, 'I too will become ill; how could I indulge in my feelings when the disease has yet to appear?'

source_sentence: 「時，淨飯王問馭者言：『太子遊園，受歡樂不？』
translation: "Then, King Jōtan asked the barker, 'Did the prince enjoy his visit to the garden?'

source_sentence: 馭者報言：『大王！
translation: The barker reported, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知太子欲向城外出遊觀看池沼，而於半路見一病人，乃至口言願扶我起。
translation: It should be noted that the prince was about to wander outside the city to look at a pond when he saw a sick man halfway across the street who even said, "Help me up!

source_sentence: 見已即勅，迴車而還。
translation: After he saw him, he ordered him to return to his chariot.

source_sentence: 宮中靜坐，思惟繫念。』
translation: He sat quietly in the palace, reflecting and fixing his thoughts.'

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王聞此語已，心內思憶阿私陀仙授記之語，決定真實。
translation: After hearing these words, King Jōtan mentally recalled the words of the Sage of Ashitaka's prediction, and he was certain they were true.

source_sentence: 『太子莫復捨家出家，我今可為太子更加五慾之事，增長太子，令著五慾，不捨出家。』
translation: 'The prince mustn't abandon his family and leave home; now, I can add to the prince's five desires and increase his attachment to them, so that he doesn't abandon leaving home.'

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王即益太子五慾之具，復倍增長。
translation: King Jōtan then gave the prince the implements of the five desires and increased them even more.

source_sentence: 而有偈說：「『太子久住宮閤中，　　欲出向園受五慾，　　路見一瘦羸病者，　　便生厭離慾想迴。
translation: A verse then said, 'After living in the palace for so long, the prince wanted to leave and go to the garden to experience the five desires, but when he saw a thin, weak, and sick man on the road, he became disillusioned with the idea of abandoning desire.

source_sentence: 端坐思惟老患因，　　我今未超何得樂？
translation: He sits up and reflects on the causes of old age and suffering, 'How could I have attained happiness before I was overtaken?'

source_sentence: 色聲香味等諸觸，　　最妙最勝不可厭，　　大士昔行善業緣，　　今受極樂無有比。』
translation: The sensations of form, sound, odor, and taste are the most sublime and excellent, and there's nothing like the conditions of good actions that the great man used to perform, which now bring him ultimate bliss.'

source_sentence: 「如是次第，太子在於宮內之時，具足而受五慾功德，晝夜無絕。
translation: "In this order, while the prince was inside the palace, he fully experienced the five desirable attributes day and night without stopping.

source_sentence: 佛本行集經路逢死屍品第十九
translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Chapter 19, Meeting Dead Corpses on the Road

source_sentence: 「爾時，作瓶天子復於一時發如是念：『此之護明菩薩大士，在於宮內，極意歡娛。
translation: "At the time, the Vase-making Prince again had this thought, 'This is the great luminous protector bodhisattva who's inside the palace and is extremely joyous.

source_sentence: 今時已至，護明菩薩宜早出家。
translation: Now that the time has come, it's appropriate for the luminous protector bodhisattva to leave home sooner rather than later.

source_sentence: 我今可為彼大士故，勸請令出厭離五慾，捨家出家。』
translation: Now, for the sake of that great person, I can persuade him to leave home and leave home because he's disillusioned with the five desires.'

source_sentence: 是時，作瓶天子心欲勸發於護明故，作意令從宮內而出向彼園林觀看善地。
translation: Then, with the desire to encourage Hōshō to leave, the princely Vairocana made it his intention to leave the palace and go to the garden to look at the good grounds.

source_sentence: 是時太子告馭者言：『謂善馭者！
translation: The prince then addressed the harnesser, 'That's right, good harnesser!

source_sentence: 汝可速駕駟馬寶車，我欲出城詣園遊戲。』
translation: You may quickly drive the carriage with horses and jewels, for I want to leave the city and go to the park to play.'

source_sentence: 是時馭者聞太子命，即疾往奏淨飯王言：『大王！
translation: Then, when the harness man heard the prince's order, he rushed to address King Jīvaka and said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知太子欲出觀看園林。』
translation: You should know that the prince wants to go out and look at the garden.'

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王勅令莊嚴迦毘羅城，掃灑街巷，荊蕀沙礫朽木、土堆糞穢瓦石，皆悉淨除。
translation: It was then that King Jīvaka ordered the city of Kapilavastu to be adorned, sweeping the streets and alleys, cleaning them of thorns, sand, debris, rotten wood, and mounds of dirt and tile.

source_sentence: 乃至園內，所有諸樹，是女名者女瓔珞嚴，男名字者，男瓔珞飾。
translation: All the trees in the park were decorated with female yarns for women and male yarns for men.

source_sentence: 復振鈴鐸，唱如是言：『莫令更有一人不祥，在太子前，或老或病，乃至太子眼見之後，生於厭離。』
translation: Again, he rang a bell and chanted this, saying, 'Don't let another person be unlucky enough to be in the prince's presence, whether old or sick, or to become disillusioned with him after he sees him.'

source_sentence: 是時馭者，即為太子嚴備好車，訖已進上白太子言：『聖子！
translation: The conductor then prepared a nice chariot for the prince and went up after finishing it and said to him, 'Noble son!

source_sentence: 善聽！
translation: Listen well!

source_sentence: 莊挍車訖，唯願知時。』
translation: Please let him know when the chariot has been decorated.'

source_sentence: 太子坐車，威神大德，從城西門出，向於外觀看園林。
translation: The prince was riding in his chariot, and his dignified spirit, the great virtuous one, left the city's west gate and went out to look at the garden.

source_sentence: 時作瓶天子於太子前，化作一屍，臥在床上，眾人舁行。
translation: The vase-making god then transformed himself into a corpse before the prince, laying on a bed while being carried by people.

source_sentence: 復以種種妙色芻衣張施其上，作於斗帳。
translation: He also spread a variety of wonderful colored regal robes over it and made a dole tent.

source_sentence: 別有無量無邊姻親，左右前後圍遶哭泣，或有散髮，或有搥胸，或復拍頭交橫兩臂，或復二手取於塵土持坌面頭，或出種種悲咽音聲，淚下如雨，大叫號慟，酸哽難聞。
translation: They were surrounded by countless and limitless in-laws, some scattering their hair, some beating their chests, some slapping their heads and crossing their arms, some putting dust in their hands and holding their heads in their hands, or emitting various sounds of pity and tears that rained down, shouting and wailing, and choking on sorrows that were hard to hear.

source_sentence: 太子覩之，心懷慘惻，問馭者言：『謂善馭者！
translation: When he saw them, the prince was distressed and asked the banner, 'That's a good banner!'

source_sentence: 此是阿誰臥之床上？
translation: Who's lying on this bed?

source_sentence: 以種種華，莊嚴圍遶，乃至雜色，芻摩衣服，作於斗帳，人舁而行，大眾周匝，稱冤叫哭。』
translation: They are surrounded by various flowers, adorned with a variety of colors, up to a variety of colors, and regal clothing, made into a bucket tent, carried by people, and surrounded by people who cry out against them.'

source_sentence: 說偈問言：「『王子妙色身端正，　　問善馭者此是誰？
translation: He spoke a verse and asked, 'The prince's wonderfully shaped body is correct, so he asked, 'Who is this person who's skillfully harnessed?'

source_sentence: 臥於床上四人舁，　　諸親圍遶叫喚哭。』
translation: He lay down on his bed and was carried by four people, surrounded by his relatives who wailed and cried.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，作瓶天子以神通力，令善馭者報太子言：『大聖太子！
translation: "At the time, the Vase-making Prince used his supernormal powers to cause the adept to report to the prince, saying, 'Great, noble prince!

source_sentence: 此名死屍。』
translation: This is called a corpse of death.'

source_sentence: 太子復問善馭者言：『死屍是何？』
translation: The prince then asked the adept, 'What's a corpse that's dead?'

source_sentence: 馭者報言：『大聖太子！
translation: The Harnesser reported, 'Great holy prince!

source_sentence: 此人已捨世間之命，無有威德，今同石木，猶如墻壁，無有別異。
translation: This person has renounced worldly life and lacks authority, and now he's like stone and wood, just like a wall, with no distinctions.

source_sentence: 捐棄一切親族知識，唯獨精神，自向彼世。
translation: Giving up all his relatives and friends, he sets out for the other world with his spirit alone.

source_sentence: 從今已後，不復更見，父母兄弟妻子眷屬，如是眷屬，生死別離，更無重見，故名死屍。』
translation: From now on, I'll never see again my parents, brothers, wives, retinues, and such retinues separated by birth and death, and I'll never see them again; therefore, I'm called a corpse of death.'

source_sentence: 向於太子而說偈言：「『已捨心意等諸根，　　屍骸無識如木石，　　諸親號咷暫圍遶，　　恩愛於此長別離。』
translation: He spoke to the prince in verse, saying, 'I've abandoned my mind and other faculties, and my corpse is without consciousness like wood and stone, surrounded by my relatives for a moment by lamentations, and here my affection is long parted.'

source_sentence: 「太子復問善馭者言：『謂善馭者！
translation: "The prince then asked the skillful harnesser, 'That's what they call a skillful harnesser!

source_sentence: 我亦有此死法以不？
translation: Is there a way for me to die like this?

source_sentence: 又此死法，我已超未？』
translation: What about this method of death, have I gone beyond it?'

source_sentence: 馭者報言：『大聖太子！
translation: The Harnesser reported, 'Great holy prince!

source_sentence: 太子尊身，於此死法，亦未免脫。
translation: 'The Prince's body is honored, but it's not exempt from this death.

source_sentence: 世間一切，若天若人，所有親族眷屬識知，各各有是別離之事，彼不見此，此不見彼。』
translation: All the people of the world, whether gods or humans, know that all their relatives and retinues are separate, and they don't see one another, and they don't see one another.'

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「『一切眾生此盡業，　　天人貴賤平等均，　　雖處善惡諸世間，　　無常至時無有異。』
translation: He then spoke the verse, saying, 'This is the end of the karma of all sentient beings, and gods and humans are equal in nobility and lowliness, even though they live in good and bad worlds, there's no difference between impermanence and time.'

source_sentence: 「爾時太子聞說此已，報馭者言：『若我此身，同有是死，死法未過，又我即今不得見天及以天中所有眷屬，彼等又亦不見於我，我今何假向彼園林遊戲快樂？
translation: "After hearing this, the prince reported to the banner, saying, 'If this body of mine had the same kind of death and the method of death hadn't passed, and I'm now unable to see the gods and their retinues, and they don't see me, why would I presumably go to that garden to play and be happy?'

source_sentence: 可速迴車還入宮內，我當思惟。』
translation: You may quickly return the chariot to the palace, for I will think about it.'

source_sentence: 是時馭者，聞太子命如是言已，即迴車駕，還向宮中。
translation: After hearing the prince's order to do so, the harness man turned his chariot around and drove back into the palace.

source_sentence: 爾時太子至宮內已，端坐思惟：『我當必死，既未能得超越死法。』
translation: After he reached the palace, the prince sat down and thought, 'I'm going to die, and I haven't been able to transcend the principle of death.'

source_sentence: 繫念默然，思惟如是：『世間果報，會歸無常。』
translation: He was absorbed in thought and silence, reflecting on this, 'The results of the world's actions will return to impermanence.'

source_sentence: 而太子初欲入宮時，有一無智愚癡相師，立在大王宮門之外，熟視瞻仰太子面顏上下形容丈夫之相，大聲唱言：『汝諸人輩一切當知！
translation: When the prince was first about to enter the palace, an ignorant and foolish master of signs stood outside the palace gate of the great king, looked closely at the prince's face, described his features as a man, and called out, 'You of all people should know this!'

source_sentence: 從今日後，至七日內，此之太子，七寶自然成就來應。』
translation: From this day until seven days from now, this prince will be answered by the natural accomplishment of seven treasures.'

source_sentence: 時淨飯王問馭者言：『汝善馭者！
translation: The king of Jīvaka then asked the harnesser, 'You're a good harnesser!

source_sentence: 引導太子，至園林中，頗得稱心，受歡樂不？』
translation: He guided the prince to the garden, where he was quite pleased and received joy, didn't he?'

source_sentence: 馭者長跪奉報王言：『大王！
translation: The banner knelt down and reported to the king, saying, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知太子今出，不至園林。』
translation: You should know that the prince is leaving now and won't go to the grove.'

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王問馭者言：『太子何故，不至園林？』
translation: The king of Jīvaka then asked the barker, 'Why isn't the prince going to the grove?'

source_sentence: 馭者白言：『大王！
translation: The barker said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 善聽！
translation: Listen well!

source_sentence: 太子出宮，於其中道，見一死人臥在床上，四人扛舁，乃至親屬，圍遶哭泣，見已即迴還入宮內，思惟不樂。』
translation: When the prince left the palace, he saw a dead man lying on a bed in the middle of the road, carried by four people and surrounded by his relatives who were weeping.

source_sentence: 時淨飯王聞此語已，心內思惟：『阿私陀仙所記必實。
translation: After hearing these words, King Jīvaka thought within himself, 'What Sage Ashitaka remembers must be true.

source_sentence: 太子莫復捨我出家，我今可更增益太子五慾之事，令其染著，勿使出家。』
translation: The prince mustn't abandon me and leave home; now, I could further enhance the prince's five desires and cause him to become defiled and not leave home.'

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王與其太子，增加服玩種種充足。
translation: The king of Jīvaka and his prince then increased their clothing and playthings in various ways.

source_sentence: 而有偈說：「『無量劫海功德行，　　太子以見命終人，　　心大悵怏懷憂愁，　　還入宮內思當死。
translation: A verse then said, 'After innumerable eons of meritorious conduct, the prince saw the person whose life had ended, and was so distressed and sad that he returned to the palace, contemplating his future death.

source_sentence: 昔置此城宮殿妙，　　太子年盛極端嚴，　　五慾稱心甚自娛，　　猶在千目歡喜苑。』
translation: In the past, he had a wonderful palace in this city, and when he was in the prime of life, the prince was so dignified that he enjoyed himself in the five desires and mind, and he was still in the garden of a thousand eyed joy.'

source_sentence: 「如是次第，太子在於宮內，具足而受五慾，恣意歡喜。
translation: "In this order, the prince was in the palace, fully satisfied with the five desires, and rejoiced at will.

source_sentence: 佛本行集經耶輸陀羅夢品第二十上
translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Yehoshua Tārāma Chapter 20

source_sentence: 「爾時，作瓶天子見太子出觀死屍，迴厭離世間五慾之事，還宮內坐，經六日後，復更如是。
translation: "It was then that the Prince of the Vase saw the prince emerge from his meditation on the dead corpse, turn away from the five worldly desires, return to his palace, and sit down inside, and then do the same again after six days.

source_sentence: 重思惟言：『此之護明菩薩大士，以著五慾，心迷放逸，不肯棄捐。
translation: He repeatedly thought, 'This is the great luminous protector bodhisattva who, because of his attachment to the five desires, was deluded and careless in mind and refused to relinquish them.

source_sentence: 今時已至，護明菩薩應須速疾捨離出家，我今可為作勸請緣。』
translation: Now that the time has come, the luminous protector bodhisattva should quickly abandon his house and leave home, so now I can be an encouragement to him.'

source_sentence: 時，作瓶天子為發太子出家心故，亦是作瓶天子宿福因緣感動，自令太子興意，欲向園林內遊。
translation: It was then that the Vase-Maker Tathāgata motivated the prince to leave home because he was motivated by the causes and conditions of the Vase-Maker Tathāgata's past merits, and he himself caused the prince to become interested in wandering through the garden.

source_sentence: 「爾時，太子召喚馭者而勅之言：『謂善馭者！
translation: "At the time, the prince summoned the harnesser and commanded him, 'Good harnesser!'

source_sentence: 急嚴駕乘，我欲入園。』
translation: I'd like to enter the park," said the harness man.

source_sentence: 馭者受命，即往啟奏淨飯王言：『大王！
translation: The tamer accepted the order and went to present it to King Jīvaka, saying, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知太子今欲出向園林遊戲觀看。』
translation: You should know that the prince now wants to go out into the garden to play and look around.'

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王勅令清淨種種莊嚴迦毘羅城，如前不異，乃至振鐸，告城內言：『莫使一人在太子前，老病及死，六根不具，令太子見，生厭離心。』
translation: The king of Jīvaka then commanded that the city of Kapilavastu be purified and adorned just as before, up to the point of raising a processional bell, and told the city, 'Don't let a person in front of the prince who's old, sick, or dying and whose six faculties aren't equipped cause the prince to see that person and become disillusioned with them.'

source_sentence: 馭者受教，進好賢車，太子知時，即坐車上，威德尊重，從城北門引駕而去。
translation: He was instructed to enter the chariot of Good Samaritan, and when the prince knew it, he sat down on the chariot, honored him with his dignified presence, and led him away through the northern gate of the city.

source_sentence: 「爾時，作瓶天子以神通力，去車不遠，於太子前，化作一人，剃除鬚髮，著僧伽梨，偏袒右肩，手執錫杖，左掌擎鉢，在路而行。
translation: "At the time, the Vase-making Prince, with his supernormal powers, was not far from the chariot when he appeared before the prince in the form of a man with shaven hair, wearing a sombrero, bared his right shoulder, holding a tin cane in his hand and carrying a bowl in his left palm as he walked along the road.

source_sentence: 太子見已，問馭者言：『謂善馭者！
translation: When the prince saw him, he asked the harnesser, 'That's a good harnesser!'

source_sentence: 此是何人？
translation: Who is this?

source_sentence: 在於我前，威儀整肅，行步徐庠，直視一尋，不觀左右，執心持行，不似餘人；剃髮剪髭，衣色純赤，以樹皮染，不同白衣，鉢色紺光，猶如石黛。』
translation: He was neat and dignified in his manner, walked slowly and quietly, looked straight ahead, didn't look to his left or right, kept his mind on his ways, and wasn't like other people; he had his hair shaved and his beard cut, his clothing was pure red and dyed with tree bark, unlike white clothing, and his bowl was as violet as a shard of rock.'

source_sentence: 時，作瓶天子以神通力，教彼馭者白太子言：『大聖太子！
translation: With supernatural powers, the Vase-Maker Prince then taught the barker to say to the prince, 'Great, noble prince!

source_sentence: 此人名為出家之人。』
translation: This person is called a renunciant.'

source_sentence: 太子復問彼馭者言：『稱出家者，此行何行？』
translation: The prince then asked the barker, 'What's the practice of someone who calls himself a renunciant?'

source_sentence: 馭者報言：『大聖太子！
translation: The Harnesser reported, 'Great holy prince!

source_sentence: 此人恒常行善法行，遠離非行，善平等行，善布施行，善調諸根，善伏自身，善與無畏，能於一切諸眾生邊生大慈悲，善不恐怖於諸眾生，善不殺害於諸眾生，善能護念於諸眾生。
translation: That person constantly conducts good Dharma practices, is free of wrong practices, conducts good equality, conducts good distribution, regulates his faculties well, subdues himself well, is good and fearless, produces great compassion for all sentient beings, isn't afraid of sentient beings, doesn't kill sentient beings well, and is able to guard the thoughts of sentient beings well.

source_sentence: 太子！
translation: Prince!

source_sentence: 以如是故，名為出家。』
translation: For this reason, it's called leaving home.'

source_sentence: 太子復問彼馭者言：『汝善馭者！
translation: The prince then asked the harness man, 'You're a good harness man!

source_sentence: 此人善能造作諸業。
translation: This person is well able to create actions.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 言法行者，此是善行，乃至善能不害眾生。
translation: This is called the practice of the Dharma, which is good practice ... good at not harming sentient beings.

source_sentence: 是故汝今將車向彼出家人邊。』
translation: Now, therefore, you must bring your chariot over to that renunciant's side.'

source_sentence: 馭者承命，白太子言：『如太子勅。』
translation: The tamer accepted the order and said to the prince, 'As the prince has commanded.'

source_sentence: 即引車向出家人所。
translation: He then led the chariot to the monk's place.

source_sentence: 是時太子至已諮問彼出家人，作如是言：『尊者大士！
translation: When he arrived, the prince asked the monk about it and said, 'Venerable monk!

source_sentence: 汝是何人？』
translation: Who are you?'

source_sentence: 時作瓶天子以神通力，教彼出家剃髮之人，報太子言：『太子！
translation: The Vase-Maker Prince then, with his supernormal powers, taught the renunciant to shave his hair and reported to the prince, saying, 'Prince!

source_sentence: 我今名為出家之人。』
translation: Now, I'm called a renunciant.'

source_sentence: 太子復問：『仁者！
translation: The prince again asked, 'Sir!

source_sentence: 何故名出家人？』
translation: Why is it called a monk?'

source_sentence: 彼復報言：『太子！
translation: Again, they replied, 'Crown Prince!

source_sentence: 我見一切世間諸行，盡是無常。
translation: "I see that all worldly activities are ultimately impermanent.

source_sentence: 觀如是已，捨於一切世俗眾事，遠離親族，求解脫故，捨家出家，作是思惟：「行何方便，能活諸命？
translation: After observing this, I abandoned all worldly affairs, separated from my family, left home and left home because I wanted to be liberated, and thought, "What method does one practice that will make one live?

source_sentence: 此事知足，善行法行，乃至善能不行殺害一切諸命。」
translation: Being satisfied with this, they well conduct themselves in accordance with the Dharma, even to the point of being well able to refrain from killing all living things."

source_sentence: 太子！
translation: "Prince!

source_sentence: 以如是故我名出家。』
translation: For this reason, I'm called a renunciant.'

source_sentence: 太子又言：『仁者所為此業大善，汝若能觀一切諸行是無常法，能知如是，乃至善與一切眾生無怖畏者，乃至心能不起殺害於諸眾生，又能活命施其安隱。』
translation: The prince also said, 'This action of yours is very good; if you can observe that all conditioned things are impermanent and can know it as such, even if you are good at being fearless with all sentient beings, even if your mind is capable of not killing or harming sentient beings and of living and giving them peace.'

source_sentence: 而有偈言：「『觀見世間是滅法，　　欲求無盡涅槃處，　　怨親已作平等心，　　世間不行欲等事。
translation: And there's a verse that says, "He observes that the world is a cessation dharma, desires to seek the inexhaustible abode of nirvāṇa, and has made his enemies and relatives equal in mind, so he doesn't pursue such things as desires in the world.

source_sentence: 隨依山林及樹下，　　或復塚間露地居，　　捨於一切諸有為，　　諦觀真如乞食活。』
translation: He follows refuge in a mountain forest or under a tree, or he might live on bare ground in a cemetery, abandoning all forms of worldly existence and truly observing the truth as he seeks to feed and live.'

source_sentence: 「爾時太子為敬法故，從車而下，徒步向彼出家人所，頭面頂禮彼出家人，三匝圍遶，還上車坐，即勅馭者，迴還宮中。
translation: "It was then that the prince, out of respect for the Dharma, got down from the chariot, went on foot to that monk, paid homage to him with his head and face, circled him three times, returned to his seat in the chariot, and ordered the harnesser to return to the palace.

source_sentence: 是時宮內，有一婦人，名曰鹿女，遙見太子歸來入宮，因於欲心而說偈言：「『淨飯大王受快樂，　　摩訶波闍無憂愁，　　宮內婇女極姝妍，　　誰能當此聖子處？』
translation: At the time, there was a woman inside the palace named Deer Woman who saw the prince returning to the palace from a distance and spoke a verse out of desire, saying, 'The great king Jīvaka is delighted, Mahāprajāpatī has no sorrow, and the women in his palace are beautiful, but who could be the place of this noble son?'

source_sentence: 「爾時太子聞此所說偈頌聲已，遍體戰慄，淚下如雨，心內愛樂涅槃之處，清淨諸根，趣向涅槃，而作是言：『我今應當取彼涅槃，我今應當證彼涅槃，我今應當行彼涅槃，我今應當住彼涅槃。』
translation: "After hearing the sound of the verse and the chant, the prince was overcome with trembling, his tears fell like rain, and his heart yearned for the place of nirvāṇa, purified his faculties, and headed for nirvāṇa, saying, 'Now, I shall attain that nirvāṇa, now shall I realize that nirvāṇa, now shall I practice that nirvāṇa, now shall I abide in that nirvāṇa.'

source_sentence: 「爾時淨飯王在宮殿內，諸臣百官左右圍遶，太子忽然入到王邊，合十指掌，曲躬而立，白父王言：『唯願大王！
translation: "It was then that the king of Jīvaka was in his palace, surrounded by ministers and officials, when the crown prince suddenly entered the king's side, put his palms together, bent his head, and said to his father, the king, 'Please, Great King!'

source_sentence: 今可聽我，我欲出家，志求涅槃。
translation: Now, listen to me, I want to leave home and aspire to nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 當知一切眾生，皆有別離。』
translation: You should know that all sentient beings are free from each other.'

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王聞其太子作是言已，如象搖樹，遍體戰動，支節怡解，淚下盈目，語聲嗚咽，報太子言：『我子太子！
translation: When the king of Jīvaka heard the prince say this, he was like an elephant shaking a tree, his whole body twitching, his limbs unhinged, his eyes filled with tears, and he spoke with a loud voice, saying to the prince, 'My son the prince!

source_sentence: 此意且停，子今非是此出家時。
translation: "Stop right there, son, this isn't the time when I left home.

source_sentence: 我亦曾經年少之時，諸根動時，而亦未見世間眾患，不行法行，又亦未曾見諸惡欲，而行苦行。
translation: When I was young and my faculties were twitching, I didn't see the world's many troubles and didn't practice the Dharma, nor did I ever see bad desires and practice austerities.

source_sentence: 子起是心，甚不堪忍。
translation: Such a state of mind in a child is quite intolerable.

source_sentence: 我子童子！
translation: My son!

source_sentence: 年少之時，心意未定，諸根未伏，而欲住彼阿蘭若時，不堪苦行。
translation: When he was young, his mind was not yet settled, and his faculties hadn't yet been quelled, and when he wanted to abide in that forest, he was unable to engage in painful practices.

source_sentence: 我子童子！
translation: My son, the boy!

source_sentence: 待我年老，我若時至，欲行法行，我當捨國付子王位，而入空閑，行於苦行。
translation: When I'm old, if the time comes for me to perform the religious practice, I'll abandon my position as king, pay my dues, and enter into seclusion to perform austerities.

source_sentence: 我子童子！
translation: My son, the boy!

source_sentence: 若子反逆，不順我心，違我語言，行於法行；子於現世，得不善法，以違尊語。
translation: If you rebel, disobey my mind, disobey my words, and conduct yourself in the practice of the Dharma, then in the present life you'll attain an unwholesome state, which is contrary to your honorable words.

source_sentence: 是故我子！
translation: Therefore, my son!

source_sentence: 此精進心，且急捨離，住於宮中，安意家內，行於俗法。
translation: With this attitude of zeal, he hastily parts with it, abides in his palace, settles down at home, and practices conventional dharmas.

source_sentence: 我子童子！
translation: My son, the boy!

source_sentence: 凡世間人，先須受於五慾之樂，然後發意，向出家心。』
translation: Ordinary people in the world must first experience the pleasures of the five desires before they will arouse the intention to leave home.'

source_sentence: 太子報言：『大王！
translation: The prince reported, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 今者不可得障子出家心。
translation: "Now, it's not possible to hinder a son's intention to leave home.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 譬如有人，從彼焚燒熾然猛焰火宅之中欲走出者，此是健人，不可遮斷。
translation: "Suppose there's a person who wants to get out of their burning, fiery home, and this is a healthy person who can't be stopped.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 諸有生者，會有別離。
translation: "All beings who are born will have separation.

source_sentence: 若人覺知世間之中，皆有別離而不能捐別離法者，此非善利。
translation: If a person realizes that there's separation in the world and doesn't donate the principle of separation, this is not good benefit.

source_sentence: 又如有人，作事不成，死時將至，而不疾為，此非善智。』
translation: Also, if someone fails to perform an act and doesn't act quickly when death is imminent, this is not good knowledge.'

source_sentence: 即為父王，而說偈言：「『若覩一切決無常，　　諸有之法終散壞，　　寧忍世間諸親別，　　死命欲至事須成。』
translation: He then spoke a verse for his father, saying, 'If I saw how all things are ultimately impermanent and how all existent things eventually disintegrate, how could I tolerate the separation of worldly relatives and how things must be accomplished when death is imminent?'

source_sentence: 「時淨飯王更復慇懃重語太子：『我子童子！
translation: "The King of Jīvaka then repeatedly spoke to the prince with great care, 'My son!

source_sentence: 決定不得捨我出家。』
translation: He's determined not to abandon me and leave home.'

source_sentence: 又諸大臣，依昔世論，各以所見，諫太子言：『大聖太子！
translation: The ministers also relied on the views of past worldly philosophers to advise the prince, saying, 'Great, noble prince!

source_sentence: 可不聞乎？
translation: Is it not worth hearing?

source_sentence: 劫初已來，韋陀論中，昔諸王輩，年少之時，各在自境，如法治化，至年老時，嫡胄相承，各將世子，以紹王位，然後向山，修行法行。
translation: Since the beginning of the eon, according to the Vedas' treatise, there have been kings who, when they were young, each stayed in their own realm and taught according to the rules, and then, when they were old, they passed their lineage down to their sons to present them to the king, and then they headed for the mountains to cultivate the practice of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 以是義故，大聖太子！
translation: For this reason, great noble prince!

source_sentence: 不得獨違先王之法。』
translation: You mustn't disobey the previous king's teaching alone.'

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王聞諸大臣作是語已，淚下如雨，一心諦觀太子之面，眼睛不瞬。
translation: After hearing these words from the ministers, King Jīvaka burst into tears and looked intently at the prince's face with single-minded attention, his eyes not blinking.

source_sentence: 是時太子，心內狐疑，憂愁不樂，還入宮中。
translation: The prince then had internal doubts and became sad and unhappy, and returned to the palace.

source_sentence: 太子至宮，諸婇女等，遙見太子，皆悉歡喜，從坐而起，或手合掌，或面嬌姿，或舞或歌，或身承奉。
translation: When the prince arrived at the palace, the women who saw the prince from a distance rejoiced and rose from their seats, either with their hands clasped together, their faces coquettish, dancing, singing, or physically presenting themselves to the prince.

source_sentence: 見太子坐，各以欲心，妭態熾盛，圍遶太子，相共娛樂，如自在天在於宮內，威德巍巍，眾相顯爀，歡樂亦然。
translation: When they saw the prince sitting, they each surrounded him with a desire for his body and an attitude of exuberance, and they entertained each other like the reigning gods inside the palace, their majestic virtue lofty, their multitudes of features visible, and their happiness.

source_sentence: 「爾時，太子以共同生諸相諸好，一齊等者，恒常莊嚴，日夜遊戲。
translation: "At the time, the prince was constantly adorned by the common birth of all appearances and beauties, all in unison, and he played day and night.

source_sentence: 又見太子如是諸相顯爀炳著，心生如是希有之想，此是月天自下於地。
translation: Seeing the prince's features shining brightly like this, his mind gave rise to this rare notion, which was that the moon gods themselves had descended to the ground.

source_sentence: 彼等婇女，見於太子如是相貌，極起羨心，或復揚眉，或有目視，或口詧語，或手相招，以是太子威神力故，令其欲心不能熾盛，復不能笑，太子亦從父王邊出。
translation: When those women see the prince's features like that, they become envious, and some of them raise their eyebrows, look at him with their eyes, speak quietly with their mouths, or beckon him with their hands.

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王即喚馭者，而告之言：『謂善馭者！
translation: King Jīvaka then summoned the harnesser and told him, 'That's a good harnesser!'

source_sentence: 太子不至彼園林乎？』
translation: Won't the prince go to the garden?'

source_sentence: 馭者報言：『大王！
translation: The barker reported, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知！
translation: should know!

source_sentence: 太子欲向彼園林中，於其半道，見有一人，剃除鬚髮，身服染衣，執杖持鉢，見彼人已，迴車入宮，端坐思惟。』
translation: Halfway up the path, the prince saw a man with shaven hair, wearing dyed clothing, and carrying a staff and bowl.

source_sentence: 「爾時，淨飯王聞是語已如是思惟：『大仙私陀言不虛妄，定恐太子捨家出家，我今更可增益五慾，令其染著勿使出家。』
translation: "After hearing those words, King Jīvaka thus considered, 'Dastavāhana Sītā's words aren't false; he's certainly afraid that the prince will abandon his family and leave home.

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王更加五慾，教住宮內，心受快樂，不許出家，重說偈言：「『太子道見出家人，　　身體著衣樹皮染，　　覩已志求無上道，　　深心唯樂在出家。
translation: The king of Jīvaka then reintroduced the five desires, taught them to live in the palace, and made them happy in his mind. He repeated the verse, saying, "The prince sees a renunciant in the path, his body clothed in tree bark and stained, and after he sees that he wants to pursue the unsurpassed path, he's deeply interested only in leaving home.

source_sentence: 觀老病死苦無邊，　　又見出家乞食活，　　厭離世間捨三患，　　慕樂解脫求無為。
translation: He observes that the suffering of old age, illness, and death has no limit, and he sees a renunciant begging for food and living, becoming disillusioned with the three worldly afflictions and abandoning them, and he yearns for liberation and seeks nothing.

source_sentence: 生老病死諸瘡疣，　　太子欲離彼等苦，　　道上見彼出家者，　　心生大喜此是真。
translation: Desiring to be free of the sores and warts of birth, old age, illness, and death, the prince sees that renunciant on the path, and his heart rejoices greatly that this is true.

source_sentence: 欲捨貪等諸恚根，　　我應剃除入山藪，　　太子欲求至真法，　　見彼沙門大喜歡。
translation: Desiring to abandon the roots of anger like greed, I should shave them off and enter the mountainous region. The prince wants to pursue the ultimate truth, and he's overjoyed to see that ascetic.

source_sentence: 乘善駟馬調御車，　　欲出三界故觀苑，　　半路見彼捨俗服，　　心喜此是上菩提。』
translation: Riding in a well-adjusted chariot with horses, he wants to escape the three realms and so contemplate the park. Halfway there, he sees him abandon his mundane clothes and rejoices that this is the highest form of enlightenment.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，淨飯王，更為太子，廣設五慾所有功德，事事加益，悉使增多。
translation: "At the time, King Jīvaka became the crown prince and established the five desires as merits, adding to them in every way and making them all increase.

source_sentence: 復於舊宮城郭之外，四面周匝，守護牢防，別更築於崇巨高壘，遶於舊院，坑壍極深，其墉堞頭，安置種種七寶羅網，羅網節目悉懸鳴鈴，宮閤門扉，嚴加禁衛。
translation: Outside the old palace wall, he surrounded it on all sides with guards and bars, built a large, high fortress that encircled the old courtyard, pitted it deep, placed a variety of seven-jeweled nets at the top of the battlements, hung bells from the nets' sections, and strictly guarded the palace gates.

source_sentence: 晨夕出入開闔之時，使有大聲，聞徹四遠門外。
translation: When it was opened and closed in the morning and evening, a great noise would be heard from four distant entrances and exits.

source_sentence: 復置無量兵車象馬，及人團隊相捉，皆被鞍甲，悉使精牢。
translation: Measureless armies, chariots, elephants, horses, and teams of men are also placed on guard, all saddled and armored, and all made to hold tightly.

source_sentence: 其次，復於宮院之外，安置無量百千壯士，形容端正，可喜無雙，悉能破他所有怨敵。
translation: Second, outside the palace grounds, he places measureless hundreds of thousands of strong men of correct appearance and pleasing features, all capable of defeating all enemies.

source_sentence: 身帶甲冑，手執三叉弓箭長刀戟矟鑹棒，諸如是等種種武仗，防護太子，內外城門。
translation: They were armored, armed, and carried trident bows and arrows, long swords, halberds, lance banners, and other such weapons to protect the prince and the inner and outer gates of the city.

source_sentence: 復教宮內，嚴加約勅，諸婇女等，晝夜莫停，奏諸音樂，顯現一切娛樂之事。
translation: He also teaches his palace to strictly enforce commands for his women to play music and display all kinds of entertainment day and night.

source_sentence: 所有女人幻惑之能，悉皆顯現，以慾枷縛，使著慾心，勿捨出家。
translation: All of the women's illusory and deceptive abilities were manifested, and they were bound by desire, causing them to become addicted to their desires and not abandon their homes.

source_sentence: 佛本行集經卷第十五
translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Volume 15
